title: Whipping Post
synopsis: Space Ghost is very angry! Brak wants a bath. Zorak loses his head. Robot babies replace other babies. Everyone knows what happens next.

transcript.speaker: Choose a format
transcript.dialogue: Regular Table Indented Condensed

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Let's get one thing straight. I'm angry!

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: (In the control room) Uh, what about?

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: What about? About everything.

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: Uh, like what?

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Like... goats.

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: (In his keyboard pod, turns and looks at SG)

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Stupid goats with their stupid little beards. Goats are stupid! The floor is stupid!

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: What about me? Stupid?

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Mmmm, I don't know, say something.

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: Uh, the guest is here? (throws lever back and forth, the studio monitor lowers with Dennis)

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: The guest is stupid.

transcript.speaker: Dennis Miller
transcript.dialogue: Thank you for having me, Ghost.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: It's great to have you here. (Turns to Zorak) Isn't it, stupid?

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: (Lowers his power band arm) Stupid Zorak!

transcript.speaker: Dennis Miller
transcript.dialogue: Which one is Zorak? Tom Servo, or...

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Say what, ass(BLEEP)

transcript.speaker: Dennis Miller
transcript.dialogue: Oh wait, I've crossed...

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: Arliss

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: What's that now?

transcript.speaker: Dennis Miller
transcript.dialogue: (laughs) I've crossed genres here.

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: Now there's a show!

transcript.speaker: Dennis Miller
transcript.dialogue: I like the shop you run over here, Space Ghost. I like the boys you surround yourself with...

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: That pisses me off. Look, I do what I want, do I make myself clear?

transcript.speaker: Dennis Miller
transcript.dialogue: Mmm hmm, well, I...

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: (aims his power bands at Dennis) DO I MAKE MYSELF CLEAR!? (dramatic music plays again)

transcript.speaker: Dennis Miller
transcript.dialogue: Sorry. (Laughs) Already I've blown it. Oftimes when I meet people I admire, you know how you kind of put your foot in the mouth right off the bat.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Oftimes when I meet people who are retired I put my foot in their mouth and I say, "Welcome to Venice. This will be your last meal!"

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: And what do they say?

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: (stretches) "Spaaaaace Ghooooost!" Man, am I angry. I'd better go blow off some steam before I explode on some fool. Aaaaaah!

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Aaaaaah! Hello, a book of postcard stamps, if you please. (shrugs) Aaaaah!

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: (stops yelling, makes a small hiccup) Oh, good. Every time I do something like that, I give myself the hiccups.

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: You sure are angry tonight.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: That's right, Zorak.

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: You know, I like this new side of you. I think it's boss.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Ah! Then you're gonna love this. (Aims his powerbands at Zorak and blasts him)

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: (flails back and form, making gibbering noises, but is not crisped)

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: (stops blasting) I'm sorry, what? (resumes blasting Zorak)

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: (flails and gibbers some more, until SG stops blasting)

transcript.speaker: Dennis Miller
transcript.dialogue: So, uh, I'm a big fan of Zorak, it's a hard thing to serve a great man like you.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Hmm.

transcript.speaker: Dennis Miller
transcript.dialogue: And oftimes this man (points toward Zorak) is of more consequence than the man (points at Space Ghost) who carries the torch.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: If you like green babies.

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: Arliss...

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: (Looks at Zorak)

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: (takes sideways glance toward camera)

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: (to Dennis) Say something.

transcript.speaker: Dennis Miller
transcript.dialogue: Well, I have two sons, 9 and 13...

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Sons are the same as kids, right?

transcript.speaker: Dennis Miller
transcript.dialogue: Exactly.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: And kids are just dumb little adults.

transcript.speaker: Dennis Miller
transcript.dialogue: You don't have any kids, do you, Space Ghost? (laughs)

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Yeah, I have two sons. Fifi and Pierre. I shave their butts out of anger. (pounds his desk) And they hate me for it. (Hums into his palm) That's the shaving noise. Want to give a shout out to your two sons?

transcript.speaker: Dennis Miller
transcript.dialogue: Marlon, Holden! (Shakes his fist forward in the air) With the Ghost!

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: (holding up his hand) Fifi, Pierre! Get off the couch! (Beat) It is clear they're poodles, right?

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: (whispering) Arliss!

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Everyone's talkin' about me, Dennis. We've become a nation of people talking about Space Ghost.

transcript.speaker: Dennis Miller
transcript.dialogue: Weren't you doin' it with that Herculoid blob for a while?

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Gloop?

transcript.speaker: Dennis Miller
transcript.dialogue: Yes.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Sure was.

transcript.speaker: Dennis Miller
transcript.dialogue: (laughs)

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: It was good too.

transcript.speaker: Dennis Miller
transcript.dialogue: (laughing) Exactly.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: (Stretching) Spaaaaace (BLEEP) F(BLEEP) catch (BLEEP) gonzale.

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: (blinks and stares)

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: I should be on HBO. What's their problem?

transcript.speaker: Dennis Miller
transcript.dialogue: HBO has no problem, you know you're doing this merely as an audition to get on their, Ghost. That's where it's all happening. All the creativity, you're saddled over here at the Cartoon Network. You know there are certain things you can't say.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Who are you again?

transcript.speaker: Dennis Miller
transcript.dialogue: My name is Dennis Miller, I'm a comedian and a fan of Space Ghost.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: (looks at a blue card) And you've come here from the future to kill me! (puts card down) Right?

transcript.speaker: Dennis Miller
transcript.dialogue: (laughs, wiping a tear from his eye) Wow, I know that's my MO. (laughs)

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Dennis, you've played a number of cops. Tell us how you became to be Robocop. The ultimate cop! (does a powerband move)

transcript.speaker: Dennis Miller
transcript.dialogue: Well, listen, I had done a one-man show as Peter Weller called "Give 'em Hell, Peter" for years, off-Broadway.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Hang on, Peter. I'm way too angry to check out each off-Broadway production of Robocop. I'll wait until it's on-way.

transcript.speaker: Dennis Miller
transcript.dialogue: (looks perplexed, shakes his head)

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Broadway?

transcript.speaker: Dennis Miller
transcript.dialogue: Could not be further out of the loop.

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: Hey, Arliss! Ah, made you look!

transcript.speaker: Brak
transcript.dialogue: (yelling in the distance, everyone looks up. Suddenly he falls from above, and lands on his head and falls down.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: What the ...!

transcript.speaker: Dennis Miller
transcript.dialogue: (laughs out loud)

transcript.speaker: Brak
transcript.dialogue: (lying on the floor) (makes gibbering noise) That's fun.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Oh great.

transcript.speaker: Brak
transcript.dialogue: Hi, my name is Brak!

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: The low quality of your name makes me very angry!

transcript.speaker: Brak
transcript.dialogue: Yeah, well I have a big dent in my hinder. Ouch!

transcript.speaker: Dennis Miller
transcript.dialogue: Nice to see you... Brak.

transcript.speaker: Brak
transcript.dialogue: Oh.. that hurt. Zorak, will you give me a bath?

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: No bath here. So screw!

transcript.speaker: Brak
transcript.dialogue: Come on, I'm dirty! Look at this dirty boy! (Continues talking in background) Hey, smell my armpits! Oh boy! Come on! It's Saturday! I need my bath!

transcript.speaker: Dennis Miller
transcript.dialogue: Brak is the one who stops in periodically.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Thats right, Dennis.

transcript.speaker: Dennis Miller
transcript.dialogue: He makes the, uh, cameo. Like Hitchcock, periodically you'll see him walking through the background.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Hitchcock's the worst director ever. Did you see "Rear Window"? It's all black and white and there are no adult situations. You know it was just made to sell toys, which you can't find anywhere!

transcript.speaker: Brak
transcript.dialogue: Here's one! (laughs)

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Give it here!

transcript.speaker: Brak
transcript.dialogue: (walks to SG's desk, humming a song) Look at this. It's got a camera.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: I hate this and all toys!

transcript.speaker: Brak
transcript.dialogue: Look out!

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: Hey Space Ghost, how come you're so angry?

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: What?

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: You need to mellow.

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: Yeah, mellow out, friend.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Don't tell me to mellow out! That'll just make me angrier!

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: You want to mellow.

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: Mellow.

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: Mellow.

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: Mellow.

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: Mellow.

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: Feel better?

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Knock it off!

transcript.speaker: Brak
transcript.dialogue: I want my bath!

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: Space Ghost is like Mr. Angry today!

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: No! Zorak's Mr. Angry!

transcript.speaker: Brak
transcript.dialogue: Hey! I wanna be somebody.

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: Oh ho! Zorak is Mr. Relaxed.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Are you relaxed enough to fight?

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: You know, I think I am. (Dramatic music in background)

transcript.speaker: Brak
transcript.dialogue: I'm Mr. Clean! (humming something)

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Perhaps you should consider going somewhere!

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: Where would I go?

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Somewhere I'm not!

transcript.speaker: Brak
transcript.dialogue: I'm Mr. Mustard!

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: (walks to the bandstand) Like here!

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: Eh! And here you are.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Now then, where would you like to go?

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: I think, I'd like, to come over there! (Walks over to SG's desk)

transcript.speaker: Brak
transcript.dialogue: I'm Mr. Pat Sajak!

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Wait, I thought I was coming over there.

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: Oh brother.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: I meant to anyway. Now come on! (Confronts Zorak, sitting in his desk)

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: Alright, alright, just relax.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: I am relaxed!

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: Relaxed enough to fight?

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Ah! Son of a-

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: It didn't hurt.

transcript.speaker: Brak
transcript.dialogue: Can I get my bath now?

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Yeah, come here, I'll give you a bath.

transcript.speaker: Brak
transcript.dialogue: Yeah boy! (Walks over to Space Ghost, laughing)

transcript.speaker: Brak
transcript.dialogue: Don't put me down!

transcript.speaker: Brak
transcript.dialogue: Ouch!

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Moltar, would you like a bath? (flies from his desk)

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: Um... I already took one actually.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: (in the control room) TAKE ANOTHER ONE!

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: (to Dennis, in Moltar's monitor) What about you? Do you need a bath?

transcript.speaker: Dennis Miller
transcript.dialogue: No I don't, Ghost.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: (invisos back to desk) Undress me with your eyes, Dennis.

transcript.speaker: Dennis Miller
transcript.dialogue: (laughing) Okay. I just undressed you, and quickly redressed you.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: (listening to the director via his communicator) What's that now, Tom? Oh. Tom's gotta switch tape and I'm going to run down the hall and take a quick wizz.

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: Please do.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: You sit comfortably.

transcript.speaker: Dennis Miller
transcript.dialogue: Zorak, you seem to have, uh, slim shoulders there. (Zorak plays his keyboard, headless) To think, the most eclectic day of my show business career, that I spoke at Bob Hope's 100th birthday, and I had to sprint over to do Space Ghost.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Hey I'm back.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: (taps his blue card) I'm back from the hallway. (Taps his card once) Hey, have you heard my famous story? (Zorak's body descends into his keyboard pod) It starts in a couple of minutes. Beat. A long beat.

transcript.speaker: Dennis Miller
transcript.dialogue: Come on. What, do you need an edit point, Space Ghost?

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: (Dramatic music in background, black and white cartoon montage from old Space Ghost cartoon plays behind him as he speaks.) The race war had begun. Machines were building robot babies to replace other babies. Everyone knows what happened next. The End. (Music and montage end)

transcript.speaker: Dennis Miller
transcript.dialogue: (laughs) Real ???

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Written by Space Ghost. (More dramatic music as he reads the "credits") Robots by ILM... and Space Ghost. George Lucas by Space Ghost. (He scribbles on his card) House lights up, people leave theatre. Trash everywhere. Zorak, clean up the trash while I go rethread the projector. Later, Dennis.

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: Eh.

transcript.speaker: Brak
transcript.dialogue: Oh no!
